positive_test_cases.question: What is the study about?
positive_test_cases.expected_answer: this study is about comparing consumer food shopping and consumption behavior in 2018 to 2017.

positive_test_cases.question: How did the consumption of the four food groups vary across household income levels?
positive_test_cases.expected_answer: High-income households were more likely to purchase fruits and vegetables relative to low- and middle-income families, and are less likely to purchase dairy products.

positive_test_cases.question: How did consumers' food attitudes vary with education level?
positive_test_cases.expected_answer: In general, consumers with post graduate degrees had the highest level of agreement with most of the food attitude statements, whereas those with lower education levels showed lower agreement.

positive_test_cases.question: Which age group made up the largest percentage of the sample population?
In which year were food at home expenditures closest to food away from home expenditures?
Which age group(s) were less likely to buy store brand items in response to price increases?

negative_test_cases.question: How did consumer income level affect choice of food outlet?
negative_test_cases.expected_answer: Higher income families shopped at fewer outlets compared to middle and low income families.

negative_test_cases.question: How did consumers' food attitudes vary with age group?
negative_test_cases.expected_answer: In general, consumers aged between 55 and 64 had the highest level of agreement with most of the food attitude statements, whereas those below 45 years old showed lower agreement.

negative_test_cases.question: How did consumers' beverage attitudes vary with education level?
negative_test_cases.expected_answer: In general, postgraduates were more likely to report sodium as the worst beverage characteristic compared to high school and college graduates.

negative_test_cases.question: Which age group was most likely to eat fresh food instead of packaged food?
Which food outlet were middle-income families more likely to shop in compared to the other two income levels?
Were college graduates more or less likely than postgraduates to consider added sugar the worst beverage characteristic?
